content: candlelit christmas trees i made these regency christmas trees for the jane austen wreath kal candles aren t something i want on my own christmas tree but tiny knitted trees with embroidered candles sure look nice on my mantle all 3 sizes are knit in the round on dpns i am a huge fan of embroidery on knits i love how it looks and how big the tapestry needles are i also love how embroidery forces you to slow down and focus on the stitches in front of you this is particularly nice during the hustle and bustle of the holidays hope you enjoy copyright december 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 finished measurements construction small 4 /10cm they are knit in the round on dpns from the top medium 5 / 13cm to the bottom the bottom is left open so they large 7 /18cm can be stuffed and stand independently the small tree can also be a hanging ornament approximate yardage my medium and large trees follow the same 20 yards/18 meters of worsted weight yarn pattern just their needle sizes change and for the large tree there are some additional rounds yarn marked in the pattern the candles are done i used patons classic wool worsted as i like the with embroidery simple stitches for the candles firm fabric but given the bottoms stays open and chain stitches for their flames so they stand independently you can choose any yarn you wish video links so the candles don t look like they are floating i how to use dpns in the round put a dark green colored stitch under them like how to do long and short stitches they are sitting on a wreath make sure this how to do chain stitches green contrasts with your main tree color abbreviations needles k = knit small & medium a set of four double-pointed k2tog = knit 2 together 1 st decreased needles dpns in size us 2 2 75mm kfb= knit front and back 1 st increased large a set of four dpns in size us 3 3 25mm p = purl ssk = slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knit-wise one gauge optional at a time to your right needle then return the 6 sts and 6 row = 1 /2 5cm over stockinette now-turned stitches back to the left needle knit them both together through the back loop notions decreasing 1 this is a left leaning decrease stuffing st s = stitch es small tree with hanger first step of embroidery completed embroidery 2 small tree using your main tree color cast on 6 sts leaving a long tail for finishing about 6 / 15 cm divide the sts over 2 dpns with 3 sts on each needle and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 k1 kfb k1 repeat 8 sts round 3 knit round 4 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 12 sts round 5-7
